thread.title: U.S. to continue trade protections on biofuels: commerce secretary

title: U.S. to continue trade protections on biofuels: commerce secretary
text: March 14, 2018 / 3:48 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago U.S. to continue trade protections on biofuels: commerce secretary Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross told a Senate panel on Wednesday that the administration of President Donald Trump plans to continue to protect U.S. biofuel producers with trade actions, such as tariffs. Washington last year levied tariffs against imports of soyoil-based biodiesel from Argentina and palm oil-based supplies from Indonesia. “It’s a very big boost for the domestic biofuels industry and we intend to continue to protect the growers in America and the processors of biofuels,” Ross said during a Senate hearing on infrastructure. Reporting by Timothy Gardner; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
